document.masterDocTitle: A study of the genus Fagineura (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae, Nematinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A study of the genus Fagineura (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae, Nematinae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Nishi 4 Kita 3 4 - 29, Bibai, Hokkaido, 072 - 0033 Japan. harahideho @ bell. ocn. ne. jp; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 5834 - 9158 Wami 1355 - 13, Nakagawa, Tochigi, 324 - 0612 Japan. banbi-fa @ ktd. biglobe. ne. jp

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Figs 4F–H, N–Q , 6I , 7G, M , 8B, K, S , 9E, M , 10G , 12D, E )

Immature stages . Late instar larva: head black ( Fig. 4O ); thoracic legs pale grey, apically and basally darkened; trunk pale grey, yellow on thoracic segment 1, with black supraspiracular and pleural stripes; supraspiracular stripe broken posteriorly; pleural stripe broken throughout; setae short. Final instar larva: 20 mm long; color as in late instar, but thoracic legs mostly pale grey and abdominal segment 10 yellow; abdominal tergum 10 not darkened; setae inconspicuous; when mature, trunk yellow ( Fig. 4Q ).

Material examined .
Holotype : ♀ , “ JAPAN : Honshu, Tochigi Pref. , Nakagawa , Koisago , 36°46’N 140°8’E , coll. larva on
Quercus acutissima
2. V. 2018
, mat. 9. V ., em.
17. IV. 2019
, S. Ibuki ” (
Figs 4F –H, N–Q
, 6I , 7G, M , 8B, K, S , 9E , 10G , 12D )
. Paratypes : JAPAN : HONSHU : 4♀ , Okayama Pref. , Soja, Minagi, coll. larvae on
Quercus sp.
,
Q. serrata
,
Q. acutissima
3. V . 1973
, em. 4. IV. 1974 , T . Kondo ( Fig. 9M ) ― KOREA : 1♀ , Gyeonggi-do , Suwon, 25. IV. 1927 , K, Sato; 1♀ , same data but
5. V . 1931
( Fig. 12E ).
Etymology . The specific name is an adjective, meaning yellow spotted, and comes from the yellow markings on the body.

Life history . Host plants: Fagaceae :
Quercus acutissima Carruth.
,
Q. serrata Murray.

Remarks .
Fagineura flavomaculata
is similar to
F. fulvistriata
and
F. togashii
in color, but they are distinguished as stated in the key. For more their differences, see the remarks of the latter two species.
